hero_dishes.name: Kibinai
hero_dishes.description: Crescent-shaped pastries filled with mutton, beef, or vegetables brought by the Karaites, an ethnic minority settled here 600 years ago
hero_dishes.origin_story: The Karaites were brought to Lithuania by Grand Duke Vytautas in the 14th century. Their food traditions survived centuries, making kibinai a living piece of medieval history
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Best found in Trakai (30 minutes from Vilnius), but available in Vilnius Old Town restaurants

signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Always paired with kepta duona or cepelinai. Beer gardens come alive in summer, but winter drinking happens in cozy, wood-paneled pubs with locals debating basketball (Lithuania's true religion)

signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served warm in winter to combat the brutal cold, or chilled as a digestif after a heavy cepelinai meal. Grandmothers make the best homemade versions
